Won the World Cup - now he is one title away from the legend's record
Lewis Hamilton secured his sixth World Cup title in Formula 1 with 2nd place behind teammate Valtteri Bottas in the US Grand Prix in Austin on Sunday.
03 Nov 2019, 22:35 by NTB
The UK's third straight World Cup title means he is only one title away from the record of Michael Schumacher, who became world champion seven times. Hamilton became champion with McLaren in 2008 and has now won five times with Mercedes: In 2014, 2015, 2017, 2018 and 2019.
With the sixth title he left legend Juan Manuel Fangio behind.

- It's overwhelming, to be honest. It was a tough race today, and Valtteri did a great job. It is a great honor to be among the legends with so many titles, Hamilton said.

- My father told me when I was six or seven years old that one must never give up, and that is in a way the family's motto.

The Formula One star threw herself into the climate debate. It causes colleagues to label him as a hypocrite.



Lewis Hamilton on the way to 2nd place and another World Cup title in Formula 1 at the US Grand Prix in Austin.üì∑ Photo: Chuck Burton, AP / NTB scanpix

Good margin
Teammate Bottas was the only one who could delay the gold party. The Finn did his share of the job by winning the race from pole position, but with Bottas victory, Hamilton needed only to place himself among the first eight to gain an unbeatable lead.
He had little trouble with that. From fifth best starting position, he immediately drove up to third place behind Bottas and Max Verstappen.
Hamilton was looking for both Bottas and Red Bull driver Verstappen to be in custody for the second time. Mercedes himself had a strategy for Hamilton with only one depot visit. On fresh tires Bottas took him again and passed him on the 52nd of the 56 laps, but Hamilton held Verstappen behind him and drove in to 2nd place.
Bottas took his fourth win of the season and seventh in his career.

Deserves it
- It feels good. It was a good win. Personally, I failed to meet my goal this year, but Lewis deserves the title. He's done a good season, the Finn said.
Two races remain in the season, but nobody can deny Lewis Hamilton another World Cup title.
"I still feel fresh and hungry, and we're going to stand in the races that remain," said Hamilton.
